<h3><a id="user-content-_sortbycollection-iteratee_identity-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_sortbycollection-iteratee_identity-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_sortbycollection-iteratee_identity-thisarg"></a><code>_.sortBy(collection, [iteratee=_.identity], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_sortbycollection-iteratee_identity-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7259" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.sortby" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates an array of elements, sorted in ascending order by the results of
running each element in a collection through <code>iteratee</code>. This method performs
a stable sort, that is, it preserves the original sort order of equal elements.
The <code>iteratee</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with three arguments:<br>
(value, index|key, collection).
<br>
<br>
If a property name is provided for <code>iteratee</code> the created <code>_.property</code>
style callback returns the property value of the given element.
<br>
<br>
If a value is also provided for <code>thisArg</code> the created <code>_.matchesProperty</code>
style callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have a matching property
value, else <code>false</code>.
<br>
<br>
If an object is provided for <code>iteratee</code> the created <code>_.matches</code> style
callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have the properties of the given
object, else <code>false</code>.</p>

<li><code>[iteratee=_.identity]</code> <em>(Function|Object|string)</em>: The function invoked per iteration.</li>
<li><code>[thisArg]</code> <em>(*)</em>: The <code>this</code> binding of <code>iteratee</code>.</li>

<h3><a id="user-content-_sortbyordercollection-iteratees-orders" class="anchor" href="#_sortbyordercollection-iteratees-orders" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_sortbyordercollection-iteratees-orders"></a><code>_.sortByOrder(collection, iteratees, [orders])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_sortbyordercollection-iteratees-orders">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7355" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.sortbyorder" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>This method is like <code>_.sortByAll</code> except that it allows specifying the
sort orders of the iteratees to sort by. If <code>orders</code> is unspecified, all
values are sorted in ascending order. Otherwise, a value is sorted in
ascending order if its corresponding order is "asc", and descending if "desc".
<br>
<br>
If a property name is provided for an iteratee the created <code>_.property</code>
style callback returns the property value of the given element.
<br>
<br>
If an object is provided for an iteratee the created <code>_.matches</code> style
callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have the properties of the given
object, else <code>false</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-68" class="anchor" href="#arguments-68" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>collection</code> <em>(Array|Object|string)</em>: The collection to iterate over.</li>
<li><code>iteratees</code> <em>(Function[]|Object[]|string[])</em>: The iteratees to sort by.</li>
<li><code>[orders]</code> <em>(boolean[])</em>: The sort orders of <code>iteratees</code>.</li>
</ol>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> users <span class="pl-k">=</span> [

  { <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>barney<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>age<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">36</span> }

<h3><a id="user-content-_wherecollection-source" class="anchor" href="#_wherecollection-source" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_wherecollection-source"></a><code>_.where(collection, source)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_wherecollection-source">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7400" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.where" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Performs a deep comparison between each element in <code>collection</code> and the
source object, returning an array of all elements that have equivalent
property values.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method supports comparing arrays, booleans, <code>Date</code> objects,
numbers, <code>Object</code> objects, regexes, and strings. Objects are compared by
their own, not inherited, enumerable properties. For comparing a single
own or inherited property value see <code>_.matchesProperty</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-69" class="anchor" href="#arguments-69" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>collection</code> <em>(Array|Object|string)</em>: The collection to search.</li>
<li><code>source</code> <em>(Object)</em>: The object of property values to match.</li>
</ol>

<p><a href="#_now">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7420" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.now" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-c1">defer</span>(<span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">stamp</span>) {

<p><a href="#_aftern-func">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7449" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.after" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>The opposite of <code>_.before</code>; this method creates a function that invokes

<h3><a id="user-content-_beforen-func" class="anchor" href="#_beforen-func" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_beforen-func"></a><code>_.before(n, func)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_beforen-func">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7507" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.before" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code>, with the <code>this</code> binding and arguments
of the created function, while it's called less than <code>n</code> times. Subsequent
calls to the created function return the result of the last <code>func</code> invocation.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-72" class="anchor" href="#arguments-72" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>

<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to restrict.</li>
</ol>

<h3><a id="user-content-_bindfunc-thisarg-partials" class="anchor" href="#_bindfunc-thisarg-partials" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_bindfunc-thisarg-partials"></a><code>_.bind(func, thisArg, [partials])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_bindfunc-thisarg-partials">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7564" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.bind" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code> with the <code>this</code> binding of <code>thisArg</code>
and prepends any additional <code>_.bind</code> arguments to those provided to the
bound function.
<br>
<br>
The <code>_.bind.placeholder</code> value, which defaults to <code>_</code> in monolithic builds,
may be used as a placeholder for partially applied arguments.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> Unlike native <code>Function#bind</code> this method does not set the "length"
property of bound functions.</p>

<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to bind.</li>
<li><code>thisArg</code> <em>(*)</em>: The <code>this</code> binding of <code>func</code>.</li>
<li><code>[partials]</code> <em>(...*)</em>: The arguments to be partially applied.</li>
</ol>

<h3><a id="user-content-_bindallobject-methodnames" class="anchor" href="#_bindallobject-methodnames" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_bindallobject-methodnames"></a><code>_.bindAll(object, [methodNames])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_bindallobject-methodnames">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7601" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.bindall" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Binds methods of an object to the object itself, overwriting the existing
method. Method names may be specified as individual arguments or as arrays
of method names. If no method names are provided all enumerable function
properties, own and inherited, of <code>object</code> are bound.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method does not set the "length" property of bound functions.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-74" class="anchor" href="#arguments-74" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>object</code> <em>(Object)</em>: The object to bind and assign the bound methods to.</li>
<li><code>[methodNames]</code> <em>(...(string|string[])</em>: The object method names to bind, specified as individual method names or arrays of method names.</li>
</ol>

<h3><a id="user-content-_bindkeyobject-key-partials" class="anchor" href="#_bindkeyobject-key-partials" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_bindkeyobject-key-partials"></a><code>_.bindKey(object, key, [partials])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_bindkeyobject-key-partials">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7658" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.bindkey" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes the method at <code>object[key]</code> and prepends
any additional <code>_.bindKey</code> arguments to those provided to the bound function.
<br>
<br>
This method differs from <code>_.bind</code> by allowing bound functions to reference
methods that may be redefined or don't yet exist.
See <a href="http://peter.michaux.ca/articles/lazy-function-definition-pattern">Peter Michaux's article</a>
for more details.
<br>
<br>
The <code>_.bindKey.placeholder</code> value, which defaults to <code>_</code> in monolithic
builds, may be used as a placeholder for partially applied arguments.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-75" class="anchor" href="#arguments-75" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>object</code> <em>(Object)</em>: The object the method belongs to.</li>
<li><code>key</code> <em>(string)</em>: The key of the method.</li>
<li><code>[partials]</code> <em>(...*)</em>: The arguments to be partially applied.</li>
</ol>

<h3><a id="user-content-_curryfunc-arityfunclength" class="anchor" href="#_curryfunc-arityfunclength" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_curryfunc-arityfunclength"></a><code>_.curry(func, [arity=func.length])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_curryfunc-arityfunclength">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7707" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.curry" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that accepts one or more arguments of <code>func</code> that when
called either invokes <code>func</code> returning its result, if all <code>func</code> arguments
have been provided, or returns a function that accepts one or more of the
remaining <code>func</code> arguments, and so on. The arity of <code>func</code> may be specified
if <code>func.length</code> is not sufficient.
<br>
<br>
The <code>_.curry.placeholder</code> value, which defaults to <code>_</code> in monolithic builds,
may be used as a placeholder for provided arguments.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method does not set the "length" property of curried functions.</p>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to curry.</li>
<li><code>[arity=func.length]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The arity of <code>func</code>.</li>
</ol>

<p><a href="#_curryrightfunc-arityfunclength">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7746" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.curryright" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>This method is like <code>_.curry</code> except that arguments are applied to <code>func</code>
in the manner of <code>_.partialRight</code> instead of <code>_.partial</code>.
<br>
<br>

builds, may be used as a placeholder for provided arguments.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method does not set the "length" property of curried functions.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_debouncefunc-wait0-options" class="anchor" href="#_debouncefunc-wait0-options" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_debouncefunc-wait0-options"></a><code>_.debounce(func, [wait=0], [options])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_debouncefunc-wait0-options">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7811" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.debounce" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a debounced function that delays invoking <code>func</code> until after <code>wait</code>
milliseconds have elapsed since the last time the debounced function was
invoked. The debounced function comes with a <code>cancel</code> method to cancel
delayed invocations. Provide an options object to indicate that <code>func</code>
should be invoked on the leading and/or trailing edge of the <code>wait</code> timeout.
Subsequent calls to the debounced function return the result of the last
<code>func</code> invocation.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> If <code>leading</code> and <code>trailing</code> options are <code>true</code>, <code>func</code> is invoked
on the trailing edge of the timeout only if the the debounced function is
invoked more than once during the <code>wait</code> timeout.
<br>
<br>
See <a href="http://drupalmotion.com/article/debounce-and-throttle-visual-explanation">David Corbacho's article</a>
for details over the differences between <code>_.debounce</code> and <code>_.throttle</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-78" class="anchor" href="#arguments-78" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to debounce.</li>
<li><code>[wait=0]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The number of milliseconds to delay.</li>
<li><code>[options]</code> <em>(Object)</em>: The options object.</li>
<li><code>[options.leading=false]</code> <em>(boolean)</em>: Specify invoking on the leading edge of the timeout.</li>
<li><code>[options.maxWait]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The maximum time <code>func</code> is allowed to be delayed before it's invoked.</li>
<li><code>[options.trailing=true]</code> <em>(boolean)</em>: Specify invoking on the trailing edge of the timeout.</li>
</ol>

<p><em>(Function)</em>:  Returns the new debounced function.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-84" class="anchor" href="#example-84" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-c">// avoid costly calculations while the window size is in flux</span>
<span class="pl-en">jQuery</span>(<span class="pl-c1">window</span>).<span class="pl-en">on</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>resize<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">debounce</span>(calculateLayout, <span class="pl-c1">150</span>));

<span class="pl-c">// invoke `sendMail` when the click event is fired, debouncing subsequent calls</span>
<span class="pl-en">jQuery</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>#postbox<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>).<span class="pl-en">on</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>click<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">debounce</span>(sendMail, <span class="pl-c1">300</span>, {
  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>leading<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">true</span>,
  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>trailing<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">false</span>
}));

<span class="pl-c">// ensure `batchLog` is invoked once after 1 second of debounced calls</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> source <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-en">EventSource</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>/stream<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">jQuery</span>(source).<span class="pl-en">on</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>message<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">debounce</span>(batchLog, <span class="pl-c1">250</span>, {
  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>maxWait<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">1000</span>
}));

<span class="pl-c">// cancel a debounced call</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> todoChanges <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">debounce</span>(batchLog, <span class="pl-c1">1000</span>);
<span class="pl-c1">Object</span>.<span class="pl-en">observe</span>(<span class="pl-smi">models</span>.<span class="pl-smi">todo</span>, todoChanges);

<span class="pl-c1">Object</span>.<span class="pl-en">observe</span>(models, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">changes</span>) {
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-c1">find</span>(changes, { <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>todo<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>type<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>delete<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>})) {
    <span class="pl-smi">todoChanges</span>.<span class="pl-en">cancel</span>();
  }
}, [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>delete<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>]);

<span class="pl-c">// ...at some point `models.todo` is changed</span>
<span class="pl-smi">models</span>.<span class="pl-smi">todo</span>.<span class="pl-smi">completed</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">true</span>;

<span class="pl-c">// ...before 1 second has passed `models.todo` is deleted</span>
<span class="pl-c">// which cancels the debounced `todoChanges` call</span>
<span class="pl-k">delete</span> <span class="pl-smi">models</span>.<span class="pl-smi">todo</span>;</pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-_delayfunc-wait-args" class="anchor" href="#_delayfunc-wait-args" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_delayfunc-wait-args"></a><code>_.delay(func, wait, [args])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_flowfuncs">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L7982" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.flow" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_memoizefunc-resolver" class="anchor" href="#_memoizefunc-resolver" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_memoizefunc-resolver"></a><code>_.memoize(func, [resolver])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_memoizefunc-resolver">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8057" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.memoize" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that memoizes the result of <code>func</code>. If <code>resolver</code> is
provided it determines the cache key for storing the result based on the
arguments provided to the memoized function. By default, the first argument
provided to the memoized function is coerced to a string and used as the
cache key. The <code>func</code> is invoked with the <code>this</code> binding of the memoized
function.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> The cache is exposed as the <code>cache</code> property on the memoized
function. Its creation may be customized by replacing the <code>_.memoize.Cache</code>
constructor with one whose instances implement the <a href="http://ecma-international.org/ecma-262/6.0/#sec-properties-of-the-map-prototype-object"><code>Map</code></a>
method interface of <code>get</code>, <code>has</code>, and <code>set</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-83" class="anchor" href="#arguments-83" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to have its output memoized.</li>
<li><code>[resolver]</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to resolve the cache key.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-89" class="anchor" href="#returns-89" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

<p><em>(Function)</em>:  Returns the new memoizing function.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-89" class="anchor" href="#example-89" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> upperCase <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">memoize</span>(<span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">string</span>) {
  <span class="pl-k">return</span> <span class="pl-smi">string</span>.<span class="pl-c1">toUpperCase</span>();
});

<span class="pl-en">upperCase</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; 'FRED'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// modifying the result cache</span>
<span class="pl-smi">upperCase</span>.<span class="pl-smi">cache</span>.<span class="pl-en">set</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>BARNEY<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">upperCase</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; 'BARNEY'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// replacing `_.memoize.Cache`</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> object <span class="pl-k">=</span> { <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> };
<span class="pl-k">var</span> other <span class="pl-k">=</span> { <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>barney<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> };
<span class="pl-k">var</span> identity <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">memoize</span>(<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-smi">identity</span>);

<span class="pl-en">identity</span>(object);
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; { 'user': 'fred' }</span>
<span class="pl-en">identity</span>(other);
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; { 'user': 'fred' }</span>

<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-smi">memoize</span>.<span class="pl-smi">Cache</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">WeakMap</span>;
<span class="pl-k">var</span> identity <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">memoize</span>(<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-smi">identity</span>);

<span class="pl-en">identity</span>(object);
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; { 'user': 'fred' }</span>
<span class="pl-en">identity</span>(other);
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; { 'user': 'barney' }</span></pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-_modargsfunc-transforms" class="anchor" href="#_modargsfunc-transforms" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_modargsfunc-transforms"></a><code>_.modArgs(func, [transforms])</code></h3>

<h3><a id="user-content-_oncefunc" class="anchor" href="#_oncefunc" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_oncefunc"></a><code>_.once(func)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_oncefunc">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8168" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.once" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that is restricted to invoking <code>func</code> once. Repeat calls
to the function return the value of the first call. The <code>func</code> is invoked
with the <code>this</code> binding and arguments of the created function.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_partialfunc-partials" class="anchor" href="#_partialfunc-partials" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_partialfunc-partials"></a><code>_.partial(func, [partials])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_partialfunc-partials">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8204" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.partial" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code> with <code>partial</code> arguments prepended
to those provided to the new function. This method is like <code>_.bind</code> except
it does <strong>not</strong> alter the <code>this</code> binding.
<br>
<br>
The <code>_.partial.placeholder</code> value, which defaults to <code>_</code> in monolithic
builds, may be used as a placeholder for partially applied arguments.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method does not set the "length" property of partially
applied functions.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-87" class="anchor" href="#arguments-87" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to partially apply arguments to.</li>
<li><code>[partials]</code> <em>(...*)</em>: The arguments to be partially applied.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-93" class="anchor" href="#returns-93" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-93" class="anchor" href="#example-93" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<h3><a id="user-content-_partialrightfunc-partials" class="anchor" href="#_partialrightfunc-partials" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_partialrightfunc-partials"></a><code>_.partialRight(func, [partials])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_partialrightfunc-partials">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8237" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.partialright" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>This method is like <code>_.partial</code> except that partially applied arguments
are appended to those provided to the new function.

applied functions.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_reargfunc-indexes" class="anchor" href="#_reargfunc-indexes" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_reargfunc-indexes"></a><code>_.rearg(func, indexes)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_reargfunc-indexes">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8267" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.rearg" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code> with arguments arranged according
to the specified indexes where the argument value at the first index is
provided as the first argument, the argument value at the second index is
provided as the second argument, and so on.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-89" class="anchor" href="#arguments-89" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<li><code>indexes</code> <em>(...(number|number[])</em>: The arranged argument indexes, specified as individual indexes or arrays of indexes.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-95" class="anchor" href="#example-95" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> rearged <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">rearg</span>(<span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">a</span>, <span class="pl-smi">b</span>, <span class="pl-smi">c</span>) {

<span class="pl-k">var</span> map <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">rearg</span>(<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-smi">map</span>, [<span class="pl-c1">1</span>, <span class="pl-c1">0</span>]);

<h3><a id="user-content-_restparamfunc-startfunclength-1" class="anchor" href="#_restparamfunc-startfunclength-1" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_restparamfunc-startfunclength-1"></a><code>_.restParam(func, [start=func.length-1])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_restparamfunc-startfunclength-1">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8293" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.restparam" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code> with the <code>this</code> binding of the
created function and arguments from <code>start</code> and beyond provided as an array.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method is based on the <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Functions/rest_parameters">rest parameter</a>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-90" class="anchor" href="#arguments-90" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to apply a rest parameter to.</li>
<li><code>[start=func.length-1]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The start position of the rest parameter.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-96" class="anchor" href="#returns-96" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

  <span class="pl-k">return</span> what <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span> <span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">initial</span>(names).<span class="pl-c1">join</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>, <span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>

<h3><a id="user-content-_spreadfunc" class="anchor" href="#_spreadfunc" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_spreadfunc"></a><code>_.spread(func)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_spreadfunc">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8353" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.spread" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code> with the <code>this</code> binding of the created
function and an array of arguments much like <a href="https://es5.github.io/#x15.3.4.3"><code>Function#apply</code></a>.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method is based on the <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Spread_operator">spread operator</a>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-91" class="anchor" href="#arguments-91" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to spread arguments over.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-97" class="anchor" href="#returns-97" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

<p><em>(Function)</em>:  Returns the new function.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-97" class="anchor" href="#example-97" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> say <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">spread</span>(<span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">who</span>, <span class="pl-smi">what</span>) {
  <span class="pl-k">return</span> who <span class="pl-k">+</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span> says <span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> <span class="pl-k">+</span> what;
});

<span class="pl-en">say</span>([<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>hello<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>]);

<span class="pl-c">// with a Promise</span>

  <span class="pl-smi">Promise</span>.<span class="pl-en">resolve</span>(<span class="pl-c1">40</span>),
  <span class="pl-smi">Promise</span>.<span class="pl-en">resolve</span>(<span class="pl-c1">36</span>)
]);

<span class="pl-smi">numbers</span>.<span class="pl-en">then</span>(<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">spread</span>(<span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>, <span class="pl-smi">y</span>) {

<h3><a id="user-content-_throttlefunc-wait0-options" class="anchor" href="#_throttlefunc-wait0-options" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_throttlefunc-wait0-options"></a><code>_.throttle(func, [wait=0], [options])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_throttlefunc-wait0-options">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8401" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.throttle" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a throttled function that only invokes <code>func</code> at most once per
every <code>wait</code> milliseconds. The throttled function comes with a <code>cancel</code>
method to cancel delayed invocations. Provide an options object to indicate
that <code>func</code> should be invoked on the leading and/or trailing edge of the
<code>wait</code> timeout. Subsequent calls to the throttled function return the
result of the last <code>func</code> call.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> If <code>leading</code> and <code>trailing</code> options are <code>true</code>, <code>func</code> is invoked
on the trailing edge of the timeout only if the the throttled function is
invoked more than once during the <code>wait</code> timeout.
<br>
<br>
See <a href="http://drupalmotion.com/article/debounce-and-throttle-visual-explanation">David Corbacho's article</a>
for details over the differences between <code>_.throttle</code> and <code>_.debounce</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-92" class="anchor" href="#arguments-92" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>func</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to throttle.</li>
<li><code>[wait=0]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The number of milliseconds to throttle invocations to.</li>
<li><code>[options]</code> <em>(Object)</em>: The options object.</li>
<li><code>[options.leading=true]</code> <em>(boolean)</em>: Specify invoking on the leading edge of the timeout.</li>

<p><a href="#_wrapvalue-wrapper">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8438" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.wrap" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_clonevalue-isdeep-customizer-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_clonevalue-isdeep-customizer-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_clonevalue-isdeep-customizer-thisarg"></a><code>_.clone(value, [isDeep], [customizer], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_clonevalue-isdeep-customizer-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8496" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.clone" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a clone of <code>value</code>. If <code>isDeep</code> is <code>true</code> nested objects are cloned,
otherwise they are assigned by reference. If <code>customizer</code> is provided it's
invoked to produce the cloned values. If <code>customizer</code> returns <code>undefined</code>
cloning is handled by the method instead. The <code>customizer</code> is bound to
<code>thisArg</code> and invoked with up to three argument; (value [, index|key, object]).
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method is loosely based on the
<a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/infrastructure.html#internal-structured-cloning-algorithm">structured clone algorithm</a>.
The enumerable properties of <code>arguments</code> objects and objects created by
constructors other than <code>Object</code> are cloned to plain <code>Object</code> objects. An
empty object is returned for uncloneable values such as functions, DOM nodes,
Maps, Sets, and WeakMaps.</p>

<ol>
<li><code>value</code> <em>(*)</em>: The value to clone.</li>
<li><code>[isDeep]</code> <em>(boolean)</em>: Specify a deep clone.</li>
<li><code>[customizer]</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function to customize cloning values.</li>

<h3><a id="user-content-_isequalvalue-other-customizer-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_isequalvalue-other-customizer-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_isequalvalue-other-customizer-thisarg"></a><code>_.isEqual(value, other, [customizer], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_isequalvalue-other-customizer-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8792" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.isequal" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Performs a deep comparison between two values to determine if they are
equivalent. If <code>customizer</code> is provided it's invoked to compare values.
If <code>customizer</code> returns <code>undefined</code> comparisons are handled by the method
instead. The <code>customizer</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with up to
three arguments: (value, other [, index|key]).
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method supports comparing arrays, booleans, <code>Date</code> objects,
numbers, <code>Object</code> objects, regexes, and strings. Objects are compared by
their own, not inherited, enumerable properties. Functions and DOM nodes
are <strong>not</strong> supported. Provide a customizer function to extend support
for comparing other values.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_ismatchobject-source-customizer-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_ismatchobject-source-customizer-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_ismatchobject-source-customizer-thisarg"></a><code>_.isMatch(object, source, [customizer], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_ismatchobject-source-customizer-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L8939" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.ismatch" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Performs a deep comparison between <code>object</code> and <code>source</code> to determine if
<code>object</code> contains equivalent property values. If <code>customizer</code> is provided
it's invoked to compare values. If <code>customizer</code> returns <code>undefined</code>
comparisons are handled by the method instead. The <code>customizer</code> is bound
to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with three arguments: (value, other, index|key).
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method supports comparing properties of arrays, booleans,
<code>Date</code> objects, numbers, <code>Object</code> objects, regexes, and strings. Functions
and DOM nodes are <strong>not</strong> supported. Provide a customizer function to extend
support for comparing other values.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_maxcollection-iteratee-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_maxcollection-iteratee-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_maxcollection-iteratee-thisarg"></a><code>_.max(collection, [iteratee], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_maxcollection-iteratee-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11898" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.max" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Gets the maximum value of <code>collection</code>. If <code>collection</code> is empty or falsey
<code>-Infinity</code> is returned. If an iteratee function is provided it's invoked
for each value in <code>collection</code> to generate the criterion by which the value
is ranked. The <code>iteratee</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with three
arguments: (value, index, collection).
<br>
<br>
If a property name is provided for <code>iteratee</code> the created <code>_.property</code>
style callback returns the property value of the given element.
<br>
<br>
If a value is also provided for <code>thisArg</code> the created <code>_.matchesProperty</code>
style callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have a matching property
value, else <code>false</code>.
<br>
<br>
If an object is provided for <code>iteratee</code> the created <code>_.matches</code> style
callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have the properties of the given
object, else <code>false</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-126" class="anchor" href="#arguments-126" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>collection</code> <em>(Array|Object|string)</em>: The collection to iterate over.</li>
<li><code>[iteratee]</code> <em>(Function|Object|string)</em>: The function invoked per iteration.</li>
<li><code>[thisArg]</code> <em>(*)</em>: The <code>this</code> binding of <code>iteratee</code>.</li>
</ol>

<p><em>(*)</em>:  Returns the maximum value.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-132" class="anchor" href="#example-132" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-c1">max</span>([<span class="pl-c1">4</span>, <span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-c1">8</span>, <span class="pl-c1">6</span>]);

  { <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>,   <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>age<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">40</span> }
];

<h3><a id="user-content-_inrangen-start0-end" class="anchor" href="#_inrangen-start0-end" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_inrangen-start0-end"></a><code>_.inRange(n, [start=0], end)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_inrangen-start0-end">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10321" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.inrange" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Checks if <code>n</code> is between <code>start</code> and up to but not including, <code>end</code>. If
<code>end</code> is not specified it's set to <code>start</code> with <code>start</code> then set to <code>0</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-130" class="anchor" href="#arguments-130" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>n</code> <em>(number)</em>: The number to check.</li>
<li><code>[start=0]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The start of the range.</li>
<li><code>end</code> <em>(number)</em>: The end of the range.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-136" class="anchor" href="#returns-136" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

<p><em>(boolean)</em>:  Returns <code>true</code> if <code>n</code> is in the range, else <code>false</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-136" class="anchor" href="#example-136" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<h3><a id="user-content-_randommin0-max1-floating" class="anchor" href="#_randommin0-max1-floating" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_randommin0-max1-floating"></a><code>_.random([min=0], [max=1], [floating])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_randommin0-max1-floating">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10359" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.random" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Produces a random number between <code>min</code> and <code>max</code> (inclusive). If only one
argument is provided a number between <code>0</code> and the given number is returned.
If <code>floating</code> is <code>true</code>, or either <code>min</code> or <code>max</code> are floats, a floating-point
number is returned instead of an integer.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-131" class="anchor" href="#arguments-131" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>[min=0]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The minimum possible value.</li>
<li><code>[max=1]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The maximum possible value.</li>
<li><code>[floating]</code> <em>(boolean)</em>: Specify returning a floating-point number.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-137" class="anchor" href="#returns-137" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

<h3><a id="user-content-_assignobject-sources-customizer-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_assignobject-sources-customizer-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_assignobject-sources-customizer-thisarg"></a><code>_.assign(object, [sources], [customizer], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_assignobject-sources-customizer-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L9372" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.assign" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Assigns own enumerable properties of source object(s) to the destination
object. Subsequent sources overwrite property assignments of previous sources.
If <code>customizer</code> is provided it's invoked to produce the assigned values.
The <code>customizer</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with five arguments:<br>
(objectValue, sourceValue, key, object, source).
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method mutates <code>object</code> and is based on
<a href="http://ecma-international.org/ecma-262/6.0/#sec-object.assign"><code>Object.assign</code></a>.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_findkeyobject-predicate_identity-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_findkeyobject-predicate_identity-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_findkeyobject-predicate_identity-thisarg"></a><code>_.findKey(object, [predicate=_.identity], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_findkeyobject-predicate_identity-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L9508" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.findkey" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>This method is like <code>_.find</code> except that it returns the key of the first
element <code>predicate</code> returns truthy for instead of the element itself.
<br>
<br>
If a property name is provided for <code>predicate</code> the created <code>_.property</code>
style callback returns the property value of the given element.
<br>
<br>
If a value is also provided for <code>thisArg</code> the created <code>_.matchesProperty</code>
style callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have a matching property
value, else <code>false</code>.
<br>
<br>
If an object is provided for <code>predicate</code> the created <code>_.matches</code> style
callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have the properties of the given
object, else <code>false</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-136" class="anchor" href="#arguments-136" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<li><code>[predicate=_.identity]</code> <em>(Function|Object|string)</em>: The function invoked per iteration.</li>
<li><code>[thisArg]</code> <em>(*)</em>: The <code>this</code> binding of <code>predicate</code>.</li>
</ol>

  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>pebbles<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> { <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>age<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">1</span>,  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>active<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-c1">true</span> }
};

<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">findKey</span>(users, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">chr</span>) {
  <span class="pl-k">return</span> <span class="pl-smi">chr</span>.<span class="pl-smi">age</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;</span> <span class="pl-c1">40</span>;

<p><a href="#_forinobject-iteratee_identity-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L9587" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.forin" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Iterates over own and inherited enumerable properties of an object invoking
<code>iteratee</code> for each property. The <code>iteratee</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked
with three arguments: (value, key, object). Iteratee functions may exit
iteration early by explicitly returning <code>false</code>.</p>

<p><a href="#_invertobject-multivalue">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L9783" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.invert" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates an object composed of the inverted keys and values of <code>object</code>.
If <code>object</code> contains duplicate values, subsequent values overwrite property
assignments of previous values unless <code>multiValue</code> is <code>true</code>.</p>
