<h3><a id="user-content-_mapvaluesobject-iteratee_identity-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_mapvaluesobject-iteratee_identity-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_mapvaluesobject-iteratee_identity-thisarg"></a><code>_.mapValues(object, [iteratee=_.identity], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_mapvaluesobject-iteratee_identity-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L9988" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.mapvalues" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates an object with the same keys as <code>object</code> and values generated by
running each own enumerable property of <code>object</code> through <code>iteratee</code>. The
iteratee function is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with three arguments:<br>
(value, key, object).
<br>
<br>
If a property name is provided for <code>iteratee</code> the created <code>_.property</code>
style callback returns the property value of the given element.
<br>
<br>
If a value is also provided for <code>thisArg</code> the created <code>_.matchesProperty</code>
style callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have a matching property
value, else <code>false</code>.
<br>
<br>
If an object is provided for <code>iteratee</code> the created <code>_.matches</code> style
callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that have the properties of the given
object, else <code>false</code>.</p>

<li><code>[thisArg]</code> <em>(*)</em>: The <code>this</code> binding of <code>iteratee</code>.</li>

<h3><a id="user-content-_mergeobject-sources-customizer-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_mergeobject-sources-customizer-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_mergeobject-sources-customizer-thisarg"></a><code>_.merge(object, [sources], [customizer], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_mergeobject-sources-customizer-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L9338" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.merge" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Recursively merges own enumerable properties of the source object(s), that
don't resolve to <code>undefined</code> into the destination object. Subsequent sources
overwrite property assignments of previous sources. If <code>customizer</code> is
provided it's invoked to produce the merged values of the destination and
source properties. If <code>customizer</code> returns <code>undefined</code> merging is handled
by the method instead. The <code>customizer</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked
with five arguments: (objectValue, sourceValue, key, object, source).</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-150" class="anchor" href="#arguments-150" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

</ol>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> users <span class="pl-k">=</span> {

<span class="pl-c">// using a customizer callback</span>

  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fruits<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>apple<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>],
  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>vegetables<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>beet<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>]
};

<span class="pl-k">var</span> other <span class="pl-k">=</span> {
  <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fruits<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>banana<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>],

};

<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">merge</span>(object, other, <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">a</span>, <span class="pl-smi">b</span>) {
  <span class="pl-k">if</span> (<span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">isArray</span>(a)) {

<p><a href="#_omitobject-predicate-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10013" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.omit" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_pickobject-predicate-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_pickobject-predicate-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_pickobject-predicate-thisarg"></a><code>_.pick(object, [predicate], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_pickobject-predicate-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10082" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.pick" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates an object composed of the picked <code>object</code> properties. Property
names may be specified as individual arguments or as arrays of property
names. If <code>predicate</code> is provided it's invoked for each property of <code>object</code>
picking the properties <code>predicate</code> returns truthy for. The predicate is
bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with three arguments: (value, key, object).</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_transformobject-iteratee_identity-accumulator-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_transformobject-iteratee_identity-accumulator-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_transformobject-iteratee_identity-accumulator-thisarg"></a><code>_.transform(object, [iteratee=_.identity], [accumulator], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_transformobject-iteratee_identity-accumulator-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10210" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.transform" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>An alternative to <code>_.reduce</code>; this method transforms <code>object</code> to a new
<code>accumulator</code> object which is the result of running each of its own enumerable
properties through <code>iteratee</code>, with each invocation potentially mutating
the <code>accumulator</code> object. The <code>iteratee</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked
with four arguments: (accumulator, value, key, object). Iteratee functions
may exit iteration early by explicitly returning <code>false</code>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-156" class="anchor" href="#arguments-156" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>object</code> <em>(Array|Object)</em>: The object to iterate over.</li>
<li><code>[iteratee=_.identity]</code> <em>(Function)</em>: The function invoked per iteration.</li>
<li><code>[accumulator]</code> <em>(*)</em>: The custom accumulator value.</li>
<li><code>[thisArg]</code> <em>(*)</em>: The <code>this</code> binding of <code>iteratee</code>.</li>
</ol>

<h3><a id="user-content-_valuesobject" class="anchor" href="#_valuesobject" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_valuesobject"></a><code>_.values(object)</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_valuesobject">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10257" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.values" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_escapestring" class="anchor" href="#_escapestring" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_escapestring"></a><code>_.escape([string=''])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_escapestring">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10523" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.escape" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Converts the characters "&amp;", "&lt;", "&gt;", '"', "'", and "`", in <code>string</code> to
their corresponding HTML entities.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> No other characters are escaped. To escape additional characters
use a third-party library like <a href="https://mths.be/he"><em>he</em></a>.
<br>
<br>
Though the "&gt;" character is escaped for symmetry, characters like
"&gt;" and "/" don't need escaping in HTML and have no special meaning
unless they're part of a tag or unquoted attribute value.
See <a href="https://mathiasbynens.be/notes/ambiguous-ampersands">Mathias Bynens's article</a>
(under "semi-related fun fact") for more details.
<br>
<br>
Backticks are escaped because in Internet Explorer &lt; 9, they can break out
of attribute values or HTML comments. See <a href="https://html5sec.org/#59">#59</a>,
<a href="https://html5sec.org/#102">#102</a>, <a href="https://html5sec.org/#108">#108</a>, and
<a href="https://html5sec.org/#133">#133</a> of the <a href="https://html5sec.org/">HTML5 Security Cheatsheet</a>
for more details.
<br>
<br>
When working with HTML you should always <a href="http://wonko.com/post/html-escaping">quote attribute values</a>
to reduce XSS vectors.</p>

<p><a href="#_parseintstring-radix">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10684" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.parseint" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Converts <code>string</code> to an integer of the specified radix. If <code>radix</code> is
<code>undefined</code> or <code>0</code>, a <code>radix</code> of <code>10</code> is used unless <code>value</code> is a hexadecimal,
in which case a <code>radix</code> of <code>16</code> is used.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> This method aligns with the <a href="https://es5.github.io/#E">ES5 implementation</a>
of <code>parseInt</code>.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_templatestring-options" class="anchor" href="#_templatestring-options" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_templatestring-options"></a><code>_.template([string=''], [options])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_templatestring-options">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L10909" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.template" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a compiled template function that can interpolate data properties
in "interpolate" delimiters, HTML-escape interpolated data properties in
"escape" delimiters, and execute JavaScript in "evaluate" delimiters. Data
properties may be accessed as free variables in the template. If a setting
object is provided it takes precedence over <code>_.templateSettings</code> values.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> In the development build <code>_.template</code> utilizes
<a href="http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/developertools/sourcemaps/#toc-sourceurl">sourceURLs</a>
for easier debugging.
<br>
<br>
For more information on precompiling templates see
<a href="https://lodash.com/custom-builds">lodash's custom builds documentation</a>.
<br>
<br>
For more information on Chrome extension sandboxes see
<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/sandboxingEval">Chrome's extensions documentation</a>.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-174" class="anchor" href="#arguments-174" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>[string='']</code> <em>(string)</em>: The template string.</li>
<li><code>[options]</code> <em>(Object)</em>: The options object.</li>
<li><code>[options.escape]</code> <em>(RegExp)</em>: The HTML "escape" delimiter.</li>
<li><code>[options.evaluate]</code> <em>(RegExp)</em>: The "evaluate" delimiter.</li>
<li><code>[options.imports]</code> <em>(Object)</em>: An object to import into the template as free variables.</li>
<li><code>[options.interpolate]</code> <em>(RegExp)</em>: The "interpolate" delimiter.</li>
<li><code>[options.sourceURL]</code> <em>(string)</em>: The sourceURL of the template's compiled source.</li>
<li><code>[options.variable]</code> <em>(string)</em>: The data object variable name.</li>
</ol>

<h4><a id="user-content-returns-180" class="anchor" href="#returns-180" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Returns</h4>

<p><em>(Function)</em>:  Returns the compiled template function.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-example-180" class="anchor" href="#example-180" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Example</h4>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-c">// using the "interpolate" delimiter to create a compiled template</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> compiled <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">template</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>hello &lt;%= user %&gt;!<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">compiled</span>({ <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> });
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; 'hello fred!'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// using the HTML "escape" delimiter to escape data property values</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> compiled <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">template</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>&lt;b&gt;&lt;%- value %&gt;&lt;/b&gt;<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">compiled</span>({ <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>value<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>&lt;script&gt;<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> });
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; '&lt;b&gt;&amp;lt;script&amp;gt;&lt;/b&gt;'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// using the "evaluate" delimiter to execute JavaScript and generate HTML</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> compiled <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">template</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>&lt;% _.forEach(users, function(user) { %&gt;&lt;li&gt;&lt;%- user %&gt;&lt;/li&gt;&lt;% }); %&gt;<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">compiled</span>({ <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>users<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>fred<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>barney<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>] });
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; '&lt;li&gt;fred&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li&gt;barney&lt;/li&gt;'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// using the internal `print` function in "evaluate" delimiters</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> compiled <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">template</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>&lt;% print("hello " + user); %&gt;!<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">compiled</span>({ <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>barney<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> });
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; 'hello barney!'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// using the ES delimiter as an alternative to the default "interpolate" delimiter</span>
<span class="pl-k">var</span> compiled <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">_</span>.<span class="pl-en">template</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>hello ${ user }!<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);
<span class="pl-en">compiled</span>({ <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>user<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span><span class="pl-k">:</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>pebbles<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span> });
<span class="pl-c">// =&gt; 'hello pebbles!'</span>

<span class="pl-c">// using custom template delimiters</span>

<h3><a id="user-content-_truncstring-options-optionslength30-optionsomission-optionsseparator" class="anchor" href="#_truncstring-options-optionslength30-optionsomission-optionsseparator" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_truncstring-options-optionslength30-optionsomission-optionsseparator"></a><code>_.trunc([string=''], [options], [options.length=30], [options.omission='...'], [options.separator])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_truncstring-options-optionslength30-optionsomission-optionsseparator">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11149" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.trunc" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Truncates <code>string</code> if it's longer than the given maximum string length.
The last characters of the truncated string are replaced with the omission
string which defaults to "...".</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-178" class="anchor" href="#arguments-178" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>[string='']</code> <em>(string)</em>: The string to truncate.</li>
<li><code>[options]</code> <em>(Object|number)</em>: The options object or maximum string length.</li>
<li><code>[options.length=30]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The maximum string length.</li>
<li><code>[options.omission='...']</code> <em>(string)</em>: The string to indicate text is omitted.</li>
<li><code>[options.separator]</code> <em>(RegExp|string)</em>: The separator pattern to truncate to.</li>
</ol>

<p><a href="#_unescapestring">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11219" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.unescape" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>The inverse of <code>_.escape</code>; this method converts the HTML entities
<code>&amp;amp;</code>, <code>&amp;lt;</code>, <code>&amp;gt;</code>, <code>&amp;quot;</code>, <code>&amp;#39;</code>, and <code>&amp;#96;</code> in <code>string</code> to their
corresponding characters.
<br>
<br>
<strong>Note:</strong> No other HTML entities are unescaped. To unescape additional HTML
entities use a third-party library like <a href="https://mths.be/he"><em>he</em></a>.</p>

<p><a href="#_attemptfunc">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11274" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.attempt" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Attempts to invoke <code>func</code>, returning either the result or the caught error
object. Any additional arguments are provided to <code>func</code> when it's invoked.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_callbackfunc_identity-thisarg" class="anchor" href="#_callbackfunc_identity-thisarg" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_callbackfunc_identity-thisarg"></a><code>_.callback([func=_.identity], [thisArg])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_callbackfunc_identity-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11320" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.callback" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates a function that invokes <code>func</code> with the <code>this</code> binding of <code>thisArg</code>
and arguments of the created function. If <code>func</code> is a property name the
created callback returns the property value for a given element. If <code>func</code>
is an object the created callback returns <code>true</code> for elements that contain
the equivalent object properties, otherwise it returns <code>false</code>.</p>

<p>Creates a function that performs a deep comparison between a given object
and <code>source</code>, returning <code>true</code> if the given object has equivalent property

numbers, <code>Object</code> objects, regexes, and strings. Objects are compared by
their own, not inherited, enumerable properties. For comparing a single
own or inherited property value see <code>_.matchesProperty</code>.</p>

<p><a href="#_mixinobjectlodash-source-options">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11520" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.mixin" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<h3><a id="user-content-_rangestart0-end-step1" class="anchor" href="#_rangestart0-end-step1" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a><a id="user-content-_rangestart0-end-step1"></a><code>_.range([start=0], end, [step=1])</code></h3>

<p><a href="#_rangestart0-end-step1">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11691" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.range" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

<p>Creates an array of numbers (positive and/or negative) progressing from
<code>start</code> up to, but not including, <code>end</code>. If <code>end</code> is not specified it's
set to <code>start</code> with <code>start</code> then set to <code>0</code>. If <code>end</code> is less than <code>start</code>
a zero-length range is created unless a negative <code>step</code> is specified.</p>

<h4><a id="user-content-arguments-192" class="anchor" href="#arguments-192" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Arguments</h4>

<ol>
<li><code>[start=0]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The start of the range.</li>
<li><code>end</code> <em>(number)</em>: The end of the range.</li>
<li><code>[step=1]</code> <em>(number)</em>: The value to increment or decrement by.</li>
</ol>

<p><a href="#_timesn-iteratee_identity-thisarg">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L11744" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a> <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/lodash.times" title="See the npm package">â</a></p>

of each invocation. The <code>iteratee</code> is bound to <code>thisArg</code> and invoked with

</ol>

<p><a href="#_supportspliceobjects">#</a> <a href="https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/3.10.1/lodash.src.js#L1051" title="View in source">â</a> <a href="#array" title="Jump back to the TOC.">â</a></p>

<p>(boolean): Detect if <code>Array#shift</code> and <code>Array#splice</code> augment array-like objects
correctly.
<br>
<br>
Firefox &lt; 10, compatibility modes of IE 8, and IE &lt; 9 have buggy Array
<code>shift()</code> and <code>splice()</code> functions that fail to remove the last element,
<code>value[0]</code>, of array-like objects even though the "length" property is
set to <code>0</code>. The <code>shift()</code> method is buggy in compatibility modes of IE 8,
while <code>splice()</code> is buggy regardless of mode in IE &lt; 9.</p>

<hr>
